citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
A female poodle puppy identification number 2713 was observed by inspectors of being in need of veterinary care. The
grey and white puppy had red and swollen tissue surrounding both eyelids. There was no discharge or crusting present
around either eye. The licensee had identified the animal prior to inspection but had not contacted the vet to have the
issue addressed at that time. Failure to seek veterinary care can result in worsening and prolonging of symptoms in the
dog. When animals are identified with injuries or illness, they must seek care by their veterinarian to prevent, control,
diagnose, and treat diseases. The licensee must ensure that the animal listed above is examined and treated by a
licensed veterinarian and ensure all animals are provided with adequate veterinary care. Correct by, 17-FEB-2023.

The facility has 5 carpets used as whelping mats that had frayed edges and strands of material hanging from them. There
was a plastic board in the back area of one enclosure that had excessive chew damage present. Cage carpets with chew
damage that leads to frayed ends can result in animals limbs being entrapped and ingestion of material. Excessive chew
damage can not be easily cleaned and sanitized and can cause sharp edges that can injure the dogs. The licensee must
ensure that all surfaces of the housing facility including houses, dens, and other furniture type fixtures and objects within
the facility that can not be readily cleaned and sanitized are repaired or replaced when worn or soiled. Correct by, 23-
FEB-2023.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the Facility Representative.
Additional Inspectors:
Lauren Murphy, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICEREnd Section

narrative:
2.40(b)(2) 
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
A female poodle puppy identification number 2713 was observed by inspectors of being in need of veterinary care. The 
grey and white puppy had red and swollen tissue surrounding both eyelids. There was no discharge or crusting present 
around either eye. The licensee had identified the animal prior to inspection but had not contacted the vet to have the 
issue addressed at that time. Failure to seek veterinary care can result in worsening and prolonging of symptoms in the 
dog. When animals are identified with injuries or illness, they must seek care by their veterinarian to prevent, control, 
diagnose, and treat diseases. The licensee must ensure that the animal listed above is examined and treated by a 
licensed veterinarian and ensure all animals are provided with adequate veterinary care. Correct by, 17-FEB-2023. 
3.1(c)(2) 
   
Housing facilities, general. 
The facility has 5 carpets used as whelping mats that had frayed edges and strands of material hanging from them. There 
was a plastic board in the back area of one enclosure that had excessive chew damage present. Cage carpets with chew 
damage that leads to frayed ends can result in animals limbs being entrapped and ingestion of material. Excessive chew 
damage can not be easily cleaned and sanitized and can cause sharp edges that can injure the dogs. The licensee must 
ensure that all surfaces of the housing facility including houses, dens, and other furniture type fixtures and objects within

the facility that can not be readily cleaned and sanitized are repaired or replaced when worn or soiled. Correct by, 23-
FEB-2023. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the Facility Representative. 
 
Additional Inspectors: 
Lauren Murphy, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICEREnd Section
